intro: Pilosella ullepitschii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands. Pilosella ullepitschii is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
